properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 5 at 3:14AM MST until February 8 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...DANGEROUS WIND CHILLS EARLY THIS MORNING FOR AREAS WEST OF THE
LARAMIE RANGE...

...BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW LIKELY IN THE WIND PRONE AREAS OF
SOUTHEAST WYOMING THROUGH MID DAY THURSDAY...

...BLIZZARD CONDITIONS POSSIBLE ALONG INTERSTATE 80 WEST OF
LARAMIE THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...WITH HEAVY SNOW LIKELY
SPREADING INTO THE INTERSTATE 25 CORRIDOR...

* WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills
as low as 40 degrees below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch,
blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5
inches possible. Wind gusts up to 50 MPH possible.

* WHERE...Laramie Valley. The worst conditions will be found
outside of Laramie. The city of Laramie could see considerably
less snowfall than areas immediately outside of town.

* WHEN...Wind Chill Warning until 8 AM MST today. The Winter Storm
Watch is in effect from Thursday afternoon through late Friday
night.

* IMPACTS...Dangerously cold wind chills may cause frost bite on
exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Travel on Thursday
night and Friday may be extremely dangerous or impossible due to
icy, snow covered roads and near whiteout conditions.
properties.instruction:
Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you
wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and mittens.

Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the
latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT
